title: Configure Command Line Warning Banners
description: Configure warning banners for command line access

controls.title: Ensure /etc/motd is configured
controls.description: The contents of the /etc/motd file are displayed to users after login and function as a message of the day for authenticated users.
controls.rationale: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to login to the system of their legal status and may assist the prosecution of intruders.
controls.remediation: Edit the /etc/motd file with the appropriate contents according to your site policy.

controls.title: Ensure /etc/issue is configured
controls.description: The contents of the /etc/issue file are displayed to users prior to login for local terminals.
controls.rationale: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to login to the system of their legal status and may assist the prosecution of intruders.
controls.remediation: Edit the /etc/issue file with the appropriate contents according to your site policy.

controls.title: Ensure /etc/issue.net is configured
controls.description: The contents of the /etc/issue.net file are displayed to users prior to login for remote connections from configured services.
controls.rationale: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to login to the system of their legal status and may assist the prosecution of intruders.
controls.remediation: Edit the /etc/issue.net file with the appropriate contents according to your site policy.

controls.title: Ensure access to /etc/motd is configured
controls.description: The /etc/motd file contains the message of the day banner.
controls.rationale: If the /etc/motd file does not have the correct ownership it could be modified by unauthorized users with unintended results.
controls.remediation: Run the following commands to set ownership and permissions on /etc/motd: chown root:root /etc/motd && chmod u-x,go-wx /etc/motd

controls.title: Ensure access to /etc/issue is configured
controls.description: The /etc/issue file contains the local login warning banner.
controls.rationale: If the /etc/issue file does not have the correct ownership it could be modified by unauthorized users with unintended results.
controls.remediation: Run the following commands to set ownership and permissions on /etc/issue: chown root:root /etc/issue && chmod u-x,go-wx /etc/issue

controls.title: Ensure access to /etc/issue.net is configured
controls.description: The /etc/issue.net file contains the remote login warning banner.
controls.rationale: If the /etc/issue.net file does not have the correct ownership it could be modified by unauthorized users with unintended results.
controls.remediation: Run the following commands to set ownership and permissions on /etc/issue.net: chown root:root /etc/issue.net && chmod u-x,go-wx /etc/issue.net
